direction.raw_text: I'm right here. Suzanne shoves her fingers through her damp hair, swallows to clear her voice.

direction.raw_text: ... I dreamed I was in jail. You'd come to see me, you were on the other side of the plastic -- like at the bank?. And you were talking, but I couldn't hear you. I put my ear to the holes and I couldn't hear you, but your mouth was moving. (MORE) (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And then I realized you couldn't talk anymore. He'd cut your vocal cords, like that dog next door.

direction.raw_text: When you were a kid?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: -- I'm on watch. Don't worry.

direction.raw_text: I know what lure to use to catch any fish in the water, but what's the lure for a woman? Truth? Lies?

direction.raw_text: . ANOTHER MOTEL - DAY 103 A tint combed through her hair, the plastic cap tied in a rakish bow, Suzanne lays out what remains of her cash by denomination. She records the amount in a pocket notebook she's using as a ledger.

direction.raw_text: (V.0.) One morning, just as the sky started to lighten -- 104 EXT. PIER - DAY 104 Jason is fishing.

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.0.) It occurs to me that you're the fisherman, not me. I can feel the tension of the line. I've taken the hook just like he did.

direction.raw_text: Coastal towns have been crossed out, one after the other.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . MOTEL ROOM - DAY 107 Alex, stitches in his head, pores over the map while Victor talks on the phone. He circles a new town on the Gulf, farther north.

direction.raw_text: eight-faceted cut... quite unique... could be the whole piece or individual stones, preference for the whole piece. Will you put out the word?... (LAUGHING) No, I'm consulting for the insurance company, isn't life strange? -- Love and kisses. He hangs up. His cheeriness vanishes. He coughs, more like a gag, and heads for the bathroom.

direction.raw_text: . BATHROOM - DAY 108 Victor spits blood in the sink. Then, after catching his breath, squirts medicine down his throat with his inhaler, exits.

direction.raw_text: . MOTEL ROOM - DAY 109 VICTOR I've called the whole network of fences from here to Tampa.

direction.raw_text: Let's hope we'll find her before she sells. (CONTINUED)

direction.raw_text: Hey! What's wrong?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is not a water-view suite in Marbella! Did you notice? There's no fruit and champagne from the management. I don't see Swiss chocolate on the pillows. My masseuse is not at the door. And I am fucking dying, Alex!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jesus. Victor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't intend to cough to death in a county clinic because you screwed up!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's not fair. The plan was for you to move the necklace. I wouldn't have had the goddamn thing. Come on... sit down... try to relax. He reaches for victor's cigarettes and crumples the package in his fist. Victor looks at his ruined smokes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not good at giving up things.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: a INT. DOCKSIDE RESTAURANT - DAY 110 Jason eats a sandwich at a'table, working on his letter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.0.) I want to take you out with me when the wind's blowing whitecaps and the current's running against the wind, just to hear your hair slap against your skin. When will I see you? He glances up. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: her hair a better, brighter color under her chef's hat, is cooking on the grill behind the counter, kidding the customers, enjoying herself. The greasy-aproned OWNER pats her rump as he goes by, not for the first time.

direction.raw_text: Long arms, short dick, they always say. One of the Fishermen guffaws. The owner looks pissed. So does Jason who witnessed it all.

direction.raw_text: About what?

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was not-fired, you jerk. I quit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . MOTEL ROOM - NIGHT 112 Jason is prying a diamond out of the necklace with his fishing knife.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) (with a laugh) For about a minute it was very satisfying.

direction.raw_text: (concentrating on the
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You did the right thing.

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . STORE - DAY 114 Jason scans the case as he approaches the JEWELER.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Help you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you buy estate diamonds?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure. Jason takes out a zip-lock bag and lays it on the counter, one of the diamonds inside. The jeweler takes it out with respect and holds it under his loupe. If Jason's nervous, it doesn't show.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It belonged to my mother. The jeweler's heard every version. He doesn't care.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .Price is the same. I can give you eighty-five hundred.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BEACH - DAY 115 The classified section already folded and marked beside her, Suzanne has propped herself on her elbows. She's looking out to sea. Talking heads bob like buoys, the waders. She notices, some distance away, a man in a suit walking along the beach. The image amuses her. He's moving in her direction. She finally recognizes Jason and raises her hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, sailor... She puts on her hat to cut the glare. From under the brim she admires his approach.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (as he reaches her) ... Look at you. What's the occasion? Jason squats down beside her and balls up the classifieds.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't need another grab-ass job. I been out talking to peoplel (MORE) (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's charter outfits a coupla towns up the coast. (NAMES OF TOWNS). They need skippers, they need crews. She stands up, brushes off the sand, rolls up her towel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So we're packing. They start walking together. From the water a MAN calls out to Suzanne.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, I thought you were coming back in. She smiles and waves goodbye.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... Too bad. I kinda liked that
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She and Jason keep walking. He no longer looks like a boy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BAR - NIGHT Alex is smelling his brandy in a booth. He looks defeated. Victor swings onto a bar stool. He takes out a wallet photo of Suzanne and Jason and passes it across to the BARTENDER.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Seen them, by any chance?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why are you asking?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My wife and son. He's been selling fish around these parts. He's totally believable. The bartender feels for his pain and takes another look at the photo, shakes his head no.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's a little classier than our usual clientele, y'know?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe you could pass it down anyway. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The bartender takes the photo.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure, man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: joins Alex in the booth. Victor raises his hand. Alex instinctively pulls his head back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't move. He leans across the table and plucks the last stitch out of Alex's wound. Alex winces.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's been irritating me all day. Did I hurt you? Threat implied. Alex stares him down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) Hey, I know this kid -- Alex and victor glance over to the bar and see Henry. He's looking at the photo Victor passed around.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hunches a catch like a depth finder. Victor is already out of the booth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Henry senses money to be made.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who are you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: His father.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I thought his father was dead. (shaking his head) Well, you look bad all right, but not dead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hungover, that's all. I'm his stepfather. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (with a chuckle) Oh, man, now I see why he blew town. victor's insulted enough to lose his patience and his poise.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The question before us is where did he go. Henry says nothing. He wants to be paid. Victor whips out a fifty-dollar bill from his top pocket. Henry reaches for it, but victor holds it back, wanting an answer first.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He wouldn't be on the Gulf. He hated the Gulf. Alex has moved up to the bar to listen behind him, unnoticed. He shakes his head at victor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's down in the Keys somewhere. Victor puts the fifty back in his own pocket. Henry stands aggressively.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That ain't cool in my book! In a swift, unexpected move, victor jams Henry back down on his bar stool. The bartender starts toward them. Alex slips out the door. The stool and Henry are toppling over. Victor catches them both, sets Henry upright.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now sit there,. and calm down. Victor is ill, but not weak. Henry looks away, the classic signal of submission.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BAR - NIGHT. Alex is waiting for victor outside. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They can't be too far. Victor stares at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I never understand your optimism.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Or he wouldn't have lied.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) Hey, mister!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think you made a friend. Victor turns around, Alex keeps walking.

direction.raw_text: is in the doorway to the bar.

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (just to be sure) Mom? The cabin is silent. He uses his fishing knife to pop loose a section of the cheap wall paneling. Behind it, a square of sheet rock has been sliced away between the studs to accommodate the pouch. He drops the pouch in his tackle box. A CAR is heard pulling up. Jason frantically starts to jam the paneling back in place. It won't hold.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CABIN - DAY Suzanne takes a flat of geraniums out of the trunk and sets them on the porch. She opens the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They'll think you stole it. He looks up at her, caught. She's walking toward the kitchen sink to wash the nursery dirt off her hands. She looks out the window at the boat again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nice boat. (over her shoulder) Are you allowed just to run around with it? 'His tension ebbs. He picks up his tackle box.

direction.raw_text: Don't take advantage, Jason. They trusted you with the job. (CONTINUED)

direction.raw_text: It's not a problem. He escapes out the door.

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) What about the messages?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm looking! Instead, she opens the letter. (CONTINUED)

direction.raw_text: (V..O.-)` Dear Gabriella. I've started this letter a dozen times -- ALEX (V..0. ) Gabby? She puts down the letter and quickly- finds the message memo.

direction.raw_text: Here it is. Mr. Raines called from (NAME OF TOWN). He said you-Id know what it was about. Do you,- need the number?

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks, honey. I'll call-you tomorrow. G'd'night . He hangs up, excited. Victor has already started to pack.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And you had no faith..

direction.raw_text: I'll save the party hats until it's in our hands.

direction.raw_text: (V.0.) I look out at the flat blue sea, and the darker bl ue where the Gulf deepens and I want you next to me. aI want to walk across the. sugar sand and wade into the water with you until the current lifts us and floats us, nothing weighting us down -- as'light and thoughtless as fish. Will I ever see you?... Love,: Jason. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's deeply moved. And it occurs to her that she has picked the wrong man.

direction.raw_text: I miss the Cadillac. Top down. Air on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You have pimp's tastes, Alex. At least my car's inconspicuous. Alex starts to get out. Victor doesn't.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You all right?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A lot of these jewelers might know my face. It's risky.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How about for me? Victor takes out the photo of Alex with the necklace and holds it up for him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nobody's seen this yet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're sick. I'll do it. Alex throws open the door and barrels out of the car.

direction.raw_text: (with a shrug) Said it was his mother's.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A seventeen-year-old kid waltzes in with a diamond as big as your toenail, and you don't wonder?? You shouldn't have touched iti You know that! All right, okay. When we recover the rest of the necklace, I'll be back. Do not, do not sell it. I'll see what I can do for you, Raines.

direction.raw_text: i appreciate that.

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Smart lady. She lets Jason make the sale. They get caught, he's underage, and she don't know a thing. I gotta give her credit.

direction.raw_text: You have interesting taste in women. Alex's gaze wanders to the game, but he can't get interested.

direction.raw_text: . VICTOR'S CAR - DAY It barrels up the highway, passing the same landmarks Suzanne and Jason did.

direction.raw_text: . CAR - DAY (TRAVELING) Victor is driving, Alex reading the map. He circles a town name. Victor cranes to see it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DOCKS - LATE DAY A storm is blowing in, and Jason walks quickly along the docks to his boat and swings aboard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BOAT - LATE DAY The waves have already started to slap against the sides of the boat. Jason tosses over his fenders and secures them to protect the boat from the pilings. He starts toward the cabin. The lock has been popped. The door is slightly ajar. He hears a NOISE inside. He draws his knife.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CABIN - LATE DAY Jason throws open the door. A figure is bent over in the galley. It turns, and by the light of the refrigerator Jason recognizes Henry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jesus, Henry... What the hell you doing?... How'd you know this was my boat??
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I saw you cast off. Good little sport boat you got, too. Oh, whoa -- hear that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where -- what?? Henry rubs his stomach.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Right here, man. I ain't been eating my share since my fishing partner ran off. Without so much as goodbye/good luck. Jason blows out a breath.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's complicated.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Always is. The boat is rockirg now. The WIND has picked up. They hear the CLANKING and RUBBING of the other boats. Jason starts checking all the hasps and latches while Henry eats the sandwich he made.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So why are you on the Gulf? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My baby finally sank on me. Right at the dock. I thought I'd work charter for awhile. (moving to help Jason with the latches)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Need a crew?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know. Maybe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's not why I came looking for you. Jason is checking the engine. Out of Henry's sight, he surreptitiously reaches inside a hidden compartment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: wraps around the concealed pouch and withdraws, reassured.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: secures the engine hatch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A guy offered me fifty bucks to tell him where you were. Sick old motherfucker. Big as God. Tried to say he was your stepfather.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe it was.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, no, no, no -- this guy was not any kind of family man, if you know what I mean. So you're in some deep shit, because he wasn't a cop neither.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What'd you tell him? Henry chuckles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lots of ways to make fifty bucks. Misunderstanding, Jason shoves him up against the counter. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You gonna lean on me, Henry?? Is that the plan? Henry is hurt and offended.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, man, I wouldn't stoop that low. And if I'd taken the fifty, I wouldn't have to be eating your shitbag sandwich neither. Jason steps back, ashamed of himself. He sits down to recover. Henry looks at him with a friend's concern.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You -- um -- you moving contraband, Jason? Jason shakes his head no.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This guy struck me as a serious problem. A few raindrops spatter the windows. Jason makes for the cabin door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Take care of the boat?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (with a grateful smile) Not likely to sink two of 'em.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DOCKS - DUSK Jason lopes along the quay, toward the businesses at the far end. The sky is about to open.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . FISH MARKET - DUSK Working behind the counter, Suzanne leans on her elbows, chatting up a customer. Jason comes through the back door. She turns.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mom, come on. He catches her hand and tows her toward the back door. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's wrong, what's happened?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We"gotta go... She anxiously follows him out the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: leans back to see around the snack rack that blocked our view of him. It's Victor. A paper bag under his arm, he goes out the front door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . FISH MARKET - DUSK The rain is sheeting down. Cars fishtail slightly on the grease not yet washed from the streets.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: reaches his car with a long stride; he can't run.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . SUZANNE'S CAR - NIGHT (TRAVELING) Suzanne is driving. 'Jason has told her. He glances at her sideways. She takes a long breath. The rain speeds up. She switches on the wipers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... I should have gone through his pockets myself. It didn't occur to me. I was in such a panic. If I'd found the necklace, Jason? I'd have taken it, too.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . SUZANNE'S CAR - NIGHT She stops at a light.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . VICTOR'S CAR - NIGHT Victor and Alex spot Suzanne's car idling at the intersection. Victor is eating an apple from the bag.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . SUZANNE'S CAR - NIGHT As she accelerates, Suzanne reaches over to pat Jason's hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry. She glances in the rear view mirror. Headlights.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's okay. I'm the one who hit the bastard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A small bridge ahead is almost ready to pivot to let a boat pass. She stamps down on the gas pedal. The car rockets forward.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . VICTOR'S CAR - NIGHT The bridge gate is lowering. Victor guns the car under the gate and across the pivoting bridge just as the gap opens.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What a thrill.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jason's white face is turned toward them in Suzanne's car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Easy, easy -- he'll see us.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's raining too hard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . SUZANNE'S CAR - NIGHT Jason looking out the back window sees only the headlights and rain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Still with us.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe it's just a tourist cruising around with his head up his butt. Neither of them believes that. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... How about Mexico? The Sea of Cortez? Your father fished for marlin there. The biggest catch he ever had. sharp left, She sees a side road coming up. She hangs a skidding into the turn, traction holding.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . VICTOR'S CAR - NIGHT Victor can't make the turn in time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Relax. She's not going anywhere. He brakes and calmly reverses in the rain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I just need to talk to her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Last time you talked, she almost crushed your skull. (TRAVELING) 152 152 INT. SUZANNE'S CAR - NIGHT Suzanne is driving fast.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anything?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not a_car in sight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You sure?
direction.name: direction
